New Records: He's the fastest Kiwi to make a World Cup hundred, and he's also the youngest.
Key Match Events: Sam Curran then struck with his first ball to dismiss Will Young for a duck in NZ's chase
Conway and Ravindra struck up a stunning stand to smash England's attack
Rachin Ravindra became NZ's youngest World Cup centurion at 23
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler, England captain: Disappointing day. Very much outplayed by NZ and tough defeat to take
Tom Latham, NZ captain: Obviously, a fantastic partnership between Rachin and Devon. From the 30-over mark onwards, to restrict them to 280 was fantastic
Rachin Ravindra, Player of the Match: Sometimes it's unbelievable at times, but great to have a great day out
Miscellaneous Highlights: Henry and Santner were the stars with the ball, keeping England in check in the first half of a typically stirring New Zealand performance
Arvind: 'Incredible to see Rachin being so articulate and charming after being in the field for 99 overs in this heat...a megastar in the making.'
Afeef: 'During England's innings, it felt like NZ's fielders are everywhere. While in New Zealand's innings, it feels like England's fielders have disappeared.'
